results.title: Anchors aweigh
results.creator_credit: Joe Pasternak, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and George Sidney
results.brief_description: There are many moments of stunning virtuosity in George Sidney’s exuberant musical entertainment “Anchors Aweigh”. One of the most wonderful of all MGM’s musicals, it is set in Los Angeles and Hollywood. Isobel Lennart’s witty screenplay is about two sailors on leave - Gene Kelly and Frank Sinatra - and their involvement with a Hollywood extra - Kathryn Grayson - whom they want to help become a musical star. The songs include “All of a Sudden my Heart Sings”, “Jealousy”, “All of a Sudden my Heart Sings”, “I Fall in Love too Easily” and “What Makes the Sunset”. Rated: G

results.title: Anchor man
results.brief_description: Describes how the Royal Australian Navy trains reservists as part-time sailors. They train once a week and receive two weeks full time training at sea where they learn the skills needed to man a Defense craft. They would back up the permanent servicemen in the event of hostile action. No other credits available.

results.title: Anatomy of violence
results.creator_credit: National Educational Television and Peter F. Davis
results.brief_description: This film presents several speeches on the relationship of violence to social reform. The speakers who took part in a Congress on the Dialectics of Liberation, held in London and sponsored by the Institute of Phenomenological Studies, include: Allen Ginsberg (poet), Paul Goodman (editor of “Liberation” magazine), Herbert Marcuse (Professor of Philosophy, University of California) and Stokely Carmichael (former Chairman Student Non-violent Co-ordinating Committee). and others. Following the speeches two social scientists evaluated the conference.

results.title: Anatomy of Hell = Anatomie de L'Enfer [DVD] (E)
results.creator_credit: Jean-Francois Lepetit, Flach Film, CB Films (France) and Catherine Breillat
results.brief_description: A woman at a nightclub is rejected by her gay, male lover, becomes suicidal and goes to the toilets to cut her wrists. She is prevented from further harm by the kindness of another gay man (played by Italian porn star Rocco Stiffredi) who follows her. Their conversation leads the woman to set up a challenge or deal, that she will pay this man and he is to listen and learn about how men see women’s bodies. Over the next four nights the two engage in the most intimate acts and conversations in trying to work out the male/female sexual dynamic. From the controversial director of 1999’s “Romance” Catherine Breillat wants to shock with close-ups of genitals and discussions of menstruation that are sure to affect some viewers. Almost banned from release in Australia. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Anatomy of crisis
results.creator_credit: Michael Latham, Video Arts and Graham Massey
results.brief_description: Causes of the Great Depression have been widely debated. One of the most widely accepted explanations is that it resulted from a failure of free market capitalism. Milton Friedman rejects this conclusion. He argues that a failure of government authorities to manage monetary policy, that is, controlling the amount of money in circulation, properly is a much more supportable explanation for the Depression. To acquire a better understanding of the pivotal role monetary forces play and to develop a better grasp of the causes of the Great Deparession, it is helpful to look closely at the role of money and the workings of banking systems. Presented by Milton Friedman. Suitable for middle, upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Anatomy of analogy
results.brief_description: “Summary: the terms cartesian product and binary operation are discussed, and the mathematical idea of morphism is developed. a morphism is a function which preserves the structure of a given set and a binary operation when

results.title: Anatomy of an inflation
results.creator_credit: Charles N. Burnaford, Federal Motion Pictures and Philip S. Goodman
results.brief_description: Inflation traditionally has resulted from excess demand pushing prices up when the economy is not operating at capacity. However, when the “production machine” is producing all that it can, increased demand cannot result in the production of more goods. Instead, the increased demand simply pushes prices up. As a result of viewing this film, students will be able to discuss what an inflation is, what its causes are, and how inflations can differ. They will also be able to understand the role of government with regard to business and the economy. Narrated by Edwin Newman. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Anatomy of a teenage marriage
results.brief_description: After five months of marriage, Dave and Vickie find that married life isn’t what they expected it to be. Suffering from boredom, frustration and problems of immaturity, they begin to realize that they must both make important changes to save their marriage. Second edition of “Marriage is a partnership”. No other credits available.

results.brief_description: SUMMARY: shows managers and supervisors an example of the successful coaching of a subordinate a junior executive has to step into his supervisor’s shoes the junior man receives counseling on how to make a successful presentation

results.title: Anatomy of a murder
results.brief_description: A riveting courtroom drama of rape and premeditated murder is brought to life with an all-star cast in Otto Preminger’s suspenseful and highly acclaimed production. Packed with drama, passion and intrigue, the film pits humble small-town lawyer, Jimmy Stewart against hard-headed city prosecutor, George C. Scott. Emotions flare as jealous army lieutenant, Ben Gazzara pleads innocent to murdering the rapist of his seductive, beautiful wife, Lee Remick. Honoured with seven Academy Award nominations and featuring a brilliant score by Duke Ellington, this film is a masterpiece that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Based on the novel by Robert Traver.
